definition: actually/place/classifier for houses, small buildings, institutions etc/that which/particle introducing a relative clause or passive/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.chinese: 丹若有所思地摩挲着下巴。

sentences.english: And I could tell him my feelings.
sentences.chinese: 我要告訴他我的所思所感。

sentences.english: She twirled her wine glass thoughtfully .
sentences.chinese: 她若有所思地轉動着葡萄酒杯。

sentences.english: Please leave a comment and tell me what you think.
sentences.chinese: 請留下評論，告訴我你的所思所想。

sentences.english: Mrs Pipchin's grey eye scanned his thoughtful face.
sentences.chinese: 皮普欽太太的灰色眼睛細看着他的若有所思的臉孔。

sentences.english: Sometimes asking for what you want can really surprise you.
sentences.chinese: 有時候問自己想要得到什麼真的匪夷所思。

sentences.english: "I guess I will, " he said reflectively .
sentences.chinese: “我想我會的，”他若有所思地說。

sentences.english: It's funny about that bar, he said musingly.
sentences.chinese: “那個酒吧很奇怪，”他若有所思地說。

sentences.english: Then she asked wistfully how much more she could earn as a doctor in China.
sentences.chinese: 然後她若有所思的問道在中國一個醫生能賺多少錢。

sentences.english: But I think of what I have done and thought during the day.
sentences.chinese: 但我回想日間的所行所思。

sentences.english: Tools are metaphors that shape how you think.
sentences.chinese: 工具是用來塑造你所思所想的。

sentences.english: Enlightened, the young man nodded and then went down the mountain.
sentences.chinese: 青年如有所思所在頷首，而後下山了。

sentences.english: When I told her what had really happened, she became very thoughtful.
sentences.chinese: 當我告訴她到底發生了什麼的時候，她變得若有所思。

sentences.english: Say unimaginably queer making a person, 349 yuan of one collect.
sentences.chinese: 說起來令人匪夷所思，三五百元一集。

sentences.english: "You are fortunate to live here, " Whipple reflected.
sentences.chinese: “你們生活在這裏真幸運，”惠普爾若有所思地說。

sentences.english: I am hung up on you. I can't get you out of my mind.
sentences.chinese: 我所思所念都是你，你不斷出現在我的腦海裏。

definition: what one has seen and heard/knowledge/one's experience
sth else/a separate matter/not the same thing/with different jobs (not colleagues)/a remarkable thing/sth special/an odd thing/sth strange or incomprehensible
to exceed all expectations/to come as a surprise
tongue-tied/unable to speak (out of surprise, embarrassment etc)
to be surprised/to be amazed/to be stunned
